solution_line_template: Lovely will sell {total_books} x {fraction_books_2_50} = <<{total_books}*{fraction_books_2_50}={books_at_2_50}>>{books_at_2_50} books for $2.50 each.
She will sell {total_books} - {books_at_2_50} = <<{total_books}-{books_at_2_50}={books_at_2}>>{books_at_2} books for $2 each.

Her earnings for the {books_at_2_50} books at ${price_per_book_2_50} will be ${price_per_book_2_50} x {books_at_2_50} = $<<{price_per_book_2_50}*{books_at_2_50}={earnings_from_2_50_books}>>{earnings_from_2_50_books}.
Her earnings for the {books_at_2} books for ${price_per_book_2} each will be ${price_per_book_2} x {books_at_2} = $<<{price_per_book_2}*{books_at_2}={earnings_from_2_books}>>{earnings_from_2_books}.
Thus, Lovely's total earning if all {total_books} books are sold is ${earnings_from_2_50_books} + ${earnings_from_2_books} = ${total_earnings}.
